005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.cameraserver.CameraServerShared;
008import edu.wpi.first.cameraserver.CameraServerSharedStore;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tInstances;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
011import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
012import edu.wpi.first.hal.HALUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.MathShared;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUsageId;
016import edu.wpi.first.networktables.MultiSubscriber;
017import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
018import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
019import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.livewindow.LiveWindow;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.shuffleboard.Shuffleboard;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.WPILibVersion;
022import java.io.File;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.io.OutputStream;
025import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
026import java.nio.file.Files;
027import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
028import java.util.function.Supplier;
029
030/**
031 * Implement a Robot Program framework. The RobotBase class is intended to be subclassed to create a
032 * robot program. The user must implement {@link #startCompetition()}, which will be called once and
033 * is not expected to exit. The user must also implement {@link #endCompetition()}, which signals to
034 * the code in {@link #startCompetition()} that it should exit.
035 *
036 * <p>It is not recommended to subclass this class directly - instead subclass IterativeRobotBase or
037 * TimedRobot.
038 */
039public abstract class RobotBase implements AutoCloseable {
040  /** The ID of the main Java thread. */
041  // This is usually 1, but it is best to make sure
042  private static long m_threadId = -1;
043
044  private final MultiSubscriber m_suball;
045
046  private static void setupCameraServerShared() {
047    CameraServerShared shared =
048        new CameraServerShared() {
049          @Override
050          public void reportVideoServer(int id) {
051            HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_PCVideoServer, id + 1);
052          }
053
054          @Override
055          public void reportUsbCamera(int id) {
056            HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_UsbCamera, id + 1);
057          }
058
059          @Override
060          public void reportDriverStationError(String error) {
061            DriverStation.reportError(error, true);
062          }
063
064          @Override
065          public void reportAxisCamera(int id) {
066            HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_AxisCamera, id + 1);
067          }
068
069          @Override
070          public Long getRobotMainThreadId() {
071            return RobotBase.getMainThreadId();
072          }
073
074          @Override
075          public boolean isRoboRIO() {
076            return !RobotBase.isSimulation();
077          }
078        };
079
080    CameraServerSharedStore.setCameraServerShared(shared);
081  }
082
083  private static void setupMathShared() {
084    MathSharedStore.setMathShared(
085        new MathShared() {
086          @Override
087          public void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
088            DriverStation.reportError(error, stackTrace);
089          }
090
091          @Override
092          public void reportUsage(MathUsageId id, int count) {
093            switch (id) {
094              case kKinematics_DifferentialDrive -> HAL.report(
095                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Kinematics, tInstances.kKinematics_DifferentialDrive);
096              case kKinematics_MecanumDrive -> HAL.report(
097                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Kinematics, tInstances.kKinematics_MecanumDrive);
098              case kKinematics_SwerveDrive -> HAL.report(
099                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Kinematics, tInstances.kKinematics_SwerveDrive);
100              case kTrajectory_TrapezoidProfile -> HAL.report(
101                  tResourceType.kResourceType_TrapezoidProfile, count);
102              case kFilter_Linear -> HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_LinearFilter, count);
103              case kOdometry_DifferentialDrive -> HAL.report(
104                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Odometry, tInstances.kOdometry_DifferentialDrive);
105              case kOdometry_SwerveDrive -> HAL.report(
106                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Odometry, tInstances.kOdometry_SwerveDrive);
107              case kOdometry_MecanumDrive -> HAL.report(
108                  tResourceType.kResourceType_Odometry, tInstances.kOdometry_MecanumDrive);
109              case kController_PIDController2 -> HAL.report(
110                  tResourceType.kResourceType_PIDController2, count);
111              case kController_ProfiledPIDController -> HAL.report(
112                  tResourceType.kResourceType_ProfiledPIDController, count);
113              default -> {
114                // NOP
115              }
116            }
117          }
118
119          @Override
120          public double getTimestamp() {
121            return WPIUtilJNI.now() * 1.0e-6;
122          }
123        });
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Constructor for a generic robot program. User code can be placed in the constructor that runs
128   * before the Autonomous or Operator Control period starts. The constructor will run to completion
129   * before Autonomous is entered.
130   *
131   * <p>This must be used to ensure that the communications code starts. In the future it would be
132   * nice to put this code into its own task that loads on boot so ensure that it runs.
133   */
134  protected RobotBase() {
135    final NetworkTableInstance inst = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault();
136    m_threadId = Thread.currentThread().getId();
137    setupCameraServerShared();
138    setupMathShared();
139    // subscribe to "" to force persistent values to propagate to local
140    m_suball = new MultiSubscriber(inst, new String[] {""});
141    if (!isSimulation()) {
142      inst.startServer("/home/lvuser/networktables.json");
143    } else {
144      inst.startServer();
145    }
146
147    // wait for the NT server to actually start
148    try {
149      int count = 0;
150      while (inst.getNetworkMode().contains(NetworkTableInstance.NetworkMode.kStarting)) {
151        Thread.sleep(10);
152        count++;
153        if (count > 100) {
154          throw new InterruptedException();
155        }
156      }
157    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
158      System.err.println("timed out while waiting for NT server to start");
159    }
160
161    LiveWindow.setEnabled(false);
162    Shuffleboard.disableActuatorWidgets();
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Returns the main thread ID.
167   *
168   * @return The main thread ID.
169   */
170  public static long getMainThreadId() {
171    return m_threadId;
172  }
173
174  @Override
175  public void close() {
176    m_suball.close();
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Get the current runtime type.
181   *
182   * @return Current runtime type.
183   */
184  public static RuntimeType getRuntimeType() {
185    return RuntimeType.getValue(HALUtil.getHALRuntimeType());
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Get if the robot is a simulation.
190   *
191   * @return If the robot is running in simulation.
192   */
193  public static boolean isSimulation() {
194    return getRuntimeType() == RuntimeType.kSimulation;
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Get if the robot is real.
199   *
200   * @return If the robot is running in the real world.
201   */
202  public static boolean isReal() {
203    RuntimeType runtimeType = getRuntimeType();
204    return runtimeType == RuntimeType.kRoboRIO || runtimeType == RuntimeType.kRoboRIO2;
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Determine if the Robot is currently disabled.
209   *
210   * @return True if the Robot is currently disabled by the Driver Station.
211   */
212  public boolean isDisabled() {
213    return DriverStation.isDisabled();
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Determine if the Robot is currently enabled.
218   *
219   * @return True if the Robot is currently enabled by the Driver Station.
220   */
221  public boolean isEnabled() {
222    return DriverStation.isEnabled();
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Determine if the robot is currently in Autonomous mode as determined by the Driver Station.
227   *
228   * @return True if the robot is currently operating Autonomously.
229   */
230  public boolean isAutonomous() {
231    return DriverStation.isAutonomous();
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Determine if the robot is currently in Autonomous mode and enabled as determined by the Driver
236   * Station.
237   *
238   * @return True if the robot is currently operating autonomously while enabled.
239   */
240  public boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
241    return DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled();
242  }
243
244  /**
245   * Determine if the robot is currently in Test mode as determined by the Driver Station.
246   *
247   * @return True if the robot is currently operating in Test mode.
248   */
249  public boolean isTest() {
250    return DriverStation.isTest();
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Determine if the robot is current in Test mode and enabled as determined by the Driver Station.
255   *
256   * @return True if the robot is currently operating in Test mode while enabled.
257   */
258  public boolean isTestEnabled() {
259    return DriverStation.isTestEnabled();
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Determine if the robot is currently in Operator Control mode as determined by the Driver
264   * Station.
265   *
266   * @return True if the robot is currently operating in Tele-Op mode.
267   */
268  public boolean isTeleop() {
269    return DriverStation.isTeleop();
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Determine if the robot is currently in Operator Control mode and enabled as determined by the
274   * Driver Station.
275   *
276   * @return True if the robot is currently operating in Tele-Op mode while enabled.
277   */
278  public boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
279    return DriverStation.isTeleopEnabled();
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Start the main robot code. This function will be called once and should not exit until
284   * signalled by {@link #endCompetition()}
285   */
286  public abstract void startCompetition();
287
288  /** Ends the main loop in {@link #startCompetition()}. */
289  public abstract void endCompetition();
290
291  private static final ReentrantLock m_runMutex = new ReentrantLock();
292  private static RobotBase m_robotCopy;
293  private static boolean m_suppressExitWarning;
294
295  /** Run the robot main loop. */
296  private static <T extends RobotBase> void runRobot(Supplier<T> robotSupplier) {
297    System.out.println("********** Robot program starting **********");
298
299    T robot;
300    try {
301      robot = robotSupplier.get();
302    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
303      Throwable cause = throwable.getCause();
304      if (cause != null) {
305        throwable = cause;
306      }
307      String robotName = "Unknown";
308      StackTraceElement[] elements = throwable.getStackTrace();
309      if (elements.length > 0) {
310        robotName = elements[0].getClassName();
311      }
312      DriverStation.reportError(
313          "Unhandled exception instantiating robot " + robotName + " " + throwable, elements);
314      DriverStation.reportError(
315          "The robot program quit unexpectedly."
316              + " This is usually due to a code error.\n"
317              + "  The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.\n"
318              + "  See https://wpilib.org/stacktrace for more information.\n",
319          false);
320      DriverStation.reportError("Could not instantiate robot " + robotName + "!", false);
321      return;
322    }
323
324    m_runMutex.lock();
325    m_robotCopy = robot;
326    m_runMutex.unlock();
327
328    if (!isSimulation()) {
329      final File file = new File("/tmp/frc_versions/FRC_Lib_Version.ini");
330      try {
331        if (file.exists() && !file.delete()) {
332          throw new IOException("Failed to delete FRC_Lib_Version.ini");
333        }
334
335        if (!file.createNewFile()) {
336          throw new IOException("Failed to create new FRC_Lib_Version.ini");
337        }
338
339        try (OutputStream output = Files.newOutputStream(file.toPath())) {
340          output.write("Java ".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
341          output.write(WPILibVersion.Version.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
342        }
343      } catch (IOException ex) {
344        DriverStation.reportError("Could not write FRC_Lib_Version.ini: " + ex, ex.getStackTrace());
345      }
346    }
347
348    boolean errorOnExit = false;
349    try {
350      robot.startCompetition();
351    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
352      Throwable cause = throwable.getCause();
353      if (cause != null) {
354        throwable = cause;
355      }
356      DriverStation.reportError("Unhandled exception: " + throwable, throwable.getStackTrace());
357      errorOnExit = true;
358    } finally {
359      m_runMutex.lock();
360      boolean suppressExitWarning = m_suppressExitWarning;
361      m_runMutex.unlock();
362      if (!suppressExitWarning) {
363        // startCompetition never returns unless exception occurs....
364        DriverStation.reportWarning(
365            "The robot program quit unexpectedly."
366                + " This is usually due to a code error.\n"
367                + "  The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.\n"
368                + "  See https://wpilib.org/stacktrace for more information.",
369            false);
370        if (errorOnExit) {
371          DriverStation.reportError(
372              "The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have "
373                  + "handled the exception above.",
374              false);
375        } else {
376          DriverStation.reportError("Unexpected return from startCompetition() method.", false);
377        }
378      }
379    }
380  }
381
382  /**
383   * Suppress the "The robot program quit unexpectedly." message.
384   *
385   * @param value True if exit warning should be suppressed.
386   */
387  public static void suppressExitWarning(boolean value) {
388    m_runMutex.lock();
389    m_suppressExitWarning = value;
390    m_runMutex.unlock();
391  }
392
393  /**
394   * Starting point for the applications.
395   *
396   * @param <T> Robot subclass.
397   * @param robotSupplier Function that returns an instance of the robot subclass.
398   */
399  public static <T extends RobotBase> void startRobot(Supplier<T> robotSupplier) {
400    if (!HAL.initialize(500, 0)) {
401      throw new IllegalStateException("Failed to initialize. Terminating");
402    }
403
404    // Force refresh DS data
405    DriverStation.refreshData();
406
407    HAL.report(
408        tResourceType.kResourceType_Language, tInstances.kLanguage_Java, 0, WPILibVersion.Version);
409
410    if (!Notifier.setHALThreadPriority(true, 40)) {
411      DriverStation.reportWarning("Setting HAL Notifier RT priority to 40 failed", false);
412    }
413
414    if (HAL.hasMain()) {
415      Thread thread =
416          new Thread(
417              () -> {
418                runRobot(robotSupplier);
419                HAL.exitMain();
420              },
421              "robot main");
422      thread.setDaemon(true);
423      thread.start();
424      HAL.runMain();
425      suppressExitWarning(true);
426      m_runMutex.lock();
427      RobotBase robot = m_robotCopy;
428      m_runMutex.unlock();
429      if (robot != null) {
430        robot.endCompetition();
431      }
432      try {
433        thread.join(1000);
434      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
435        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
436      }
437    } else {
438      runRobot(robotSupplier);
439    }
440
441    // On RIO, this will just terminate rather than shutting down cleanly (it's a no-op in sim).
442    // It's not worth the risk of hanging on shutdown when we want the code to restart as quickly
443    // as possible.
444    HAL.terminate();
445
446    HAL.shutdown();
447
448    System.exit(0);
449  }
450}
